title: Ending design handoff: this is our fight - UX Collective

last_post.content:
Two interesting article on the idea of "no-handoff":
- https://uxdesign.cc/ending-design-handoff-this-is-our-fight-b376d2b58e4a by Shamsi Brinn
- https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2023/03/best-handoff-is-no-handoff/ by @vitalyf
I like the approach of a more agile and collaborative way of working, back and forth with developers and building the product together.
For me, it doesn't mean "no mockups and no documentation", but being smart about it, having more communication with dev teams to avoid the "designer in a ivory tower designs somethings and sends it to devs who do what they can".

Checkout our newest work: Self-Refine: Iterative Refinement with Self-Feedback

We show that LLMs such as GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 can:
1. Generate a draft output
2. Generate textual feedback critiquing it
3. Refine the draft output using the feedback
4. Iterate, as needed

Improves performance on 7 tasks including code and creative text generation. No supervised training, no RL, no human feedback!

Led by Aman Madaan
PDF: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.17651.pdf
Project page: https://selfrefine.info

If anyone has a secret mobile phone hidden from an abusive partner, remember to switch off or put in airplane mode etc as described below, or the phone will be activated with the loud alert on the evening of 23/04.

Please share this to help keep others safe

The alert will say:

“This is a test of Emergency Alerts, a new UK government service that will warn you if there’s a life-threatening emergency nearby.

In an actual emergency, follow the instructions in the alert to keep yourself and others safe.

Visit gov.uk/alerts for more information.

This is a test. You do not need to take any action.”

Mobile phone masts in the surrounding area will broadcast an alert. Every compatible mobile phone or tablet in range of a mast will receive the alert.

Your mobile phone or tablet does not have to be connected to mobile data or wifi to get alerts.

You can opt out of emergency alerts, but the government advises you should keep them switched on for your own safety.

To opt out:

Search your settings for ‘emergency alerts’.
Turn off ‘severe alerts’ and ‘extreme alerts’.
If you still get alerts, contact your device manufacturer for help.

A part of me has trouble with the idea of a knowledge graph because we aren’t even able to define what knowledge is. Another part of me suspects we aren’t able to define anything at all, so who cares. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gettier_problem

Laplace's Rule of Succession essentially says "if you see k heads out of n coin flips and you have no additional info, your best estimate for the bias of the coin is (k+1)/(n+2)." (What?! 😲)

It actually says a bit more, but that's the gist of it: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rule_of_succession

Unfortunately, the standard proof of this is very clunky and ugly, involving computations with the Beta distribution, integrals, and whatnot.

Except for this nice, "symmetry-based" argument! 🏆 Outlined in this blog post by Eric Neyman: https://ericneyman.wordpress.com/2020/11/29/an-elegant-proof-of-laplaces-rule-of-succession/
